content.webTitle: Rugby league: Noble says he was forced  to leave Bradford

fields.headline: Noble says he was forced  to leave Bradford
fields.bodyText: Brian Noble claimed to have been driven out of Bradford yesterday as his move to Wigan was finally confirmed. "It's not been me that has brought this about," said Noble, the most successful coach in Bradford's history who has left the Super League champions for the current bottom club in a deal that runs until the end of 2008, and allows him to continue as the Great Britain coach on a part-time basis. Noble's first game with Wigan is at Huddersfield tomorrow, when a repeat of the 52-18 victory he enjoyed against the same opposition in his last game in charge of the Bulls on Tuesday is beyond the Warriors' wildest dreams. Wigan have lost their last seven league games.
